channel.title: State of Louisiana to withdraw from the United States of America
channel.description:
https://petitions.whitehouse.gov/petition/peacefully-grant-state-louisiana-withdraw-united-states-america-and-create-its-own-new-government/1wrvtngl
woah wat, far better than my last thread.
now fucking debate holy civil war

item.title: State of Louisiana to withdraw from the United States of America
item.dc:creator: @meiscooldude meiscooldude
item.description:
@meiscooldude wrote:

Who cares if they secede? Who cares what their motives are?

I have no intention to force the people of Louisiana to stay in the Union.

Legality is a silly issue, if they do secede and it is found to be illegal, do we go to war? How many people would die? How many people would die if we just shrugged our shoulders and moved on?

While I don’t always agree with everyone, I do believe in self government. If we claim that our Governments are by the people, of the people, and for the people, why not let them self govern peacefully?

If they end up not being able to support themselves then fine, let them learn a lesson the hard way. If they become prosperous, we should probably take a lesson from them.

Read full topic

item.title: State of Louisiana to withdraw from the United States of America
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Acorn_:

& Then, let’s say they do secede. They would almost immediately be taken over by the surronding country’s like Mexico and Canada providing them with tons of new economic resources.

wrong, texas will not be taken over by canada, mexico or any other ‘developed country’

zyle1992:

At that point, they may no longer have the backing of the United States, or its allies.

wrong, if texas succeeds from the states it will most likely keep ties with the states because the succession will in all certainty not turn violent

zyle1992:

They would need to create their own infrastructure.

they already have their own infrastructure

Most companies would take advantage of this, by serving the new nation, with increased cost. Companies could monopolize.

so what prevents companies from doing that now?

new companies won’t just barge into texas because it became its own nation and they wouldn’t be able to pull a monopoly because they’d have to compete with existing companies

zyle1992:

They would still need a form of government, which may or may not be easy.

except that if texas were to succeed nothing would change government wise, the existing texas state government would be free to rule texas however they damn well please without the big pesky “big government” in the way

zyle1992:

One person could take over, and turn it into a democratic nation, or communist, or anything else.

if one person “takes over” the state of texas and turns it into a communist nation, it will be because the people wanted that to happen, at the start at least

you don’t get into a position of power and keep it by shitting on everyone below you, you shit on everyone below you when you are already in power and so long as you don’t shit on the people who keep the people below you in check then there’s no problem

zyle1992:

After that, laws would need to be made, or remade, because the federal government no longer has any leeway.

existing laws would be kept minus the ones that prompted texas to succeed

example of laws that would be ditched should texas succeed:

[ul][li]people under 25 being covered by their parents healthcare[/li]
[li]insurance companies being forced to pay for people with pre-existing conditions[/li]
[li]force people to get health-insurance or pay a fine so the cost of healthcare for everyone goes down[/li][/ul]

I shuddered a little writing these examples of fascist commie nazi laws that the supreme overlord dictator obama forced onto the people

zyle1992:

Borders would be put up to protect the United States, so now there’s the whole international issue to deal with.

the only international issue would be any country that tries to take over texas

you guys know about south sudan right? they succeeded from sudan, as of yet, no country has tried to take them over

zyle1992:

Assuming the drug cartels don’t decimate the ex-state Texas, and they are not allies with anyone (cut ALL ties to US and Mexico) anyone can come in, take down this new weakened government, and claim the territory for themselves.

please see above, no recognised country will take over texas

drug cartels and the likes can however attempt to take over texas if they really want, there’s some MAJOR FUCKING FLAWS with this plan however

[ul][li]guns are legal[/li]
[li]guns are LEGAL[/li]
[li]texas would have a basic MILITARY FORCE[/li]
[li]no ‘western country’ would stand for a strong military force taking over texas, the united states would not stand for a military force taking over texas[/li][/ul]

hell the god damn united states can’t even let a country have a civil war when it has an invested interest in that country, what makes you think the states would just forget about texas?

here’s how an invasion by a military force on texas would go down: the texan citizens would fight with the metric shit-ton of guns they have, the international western community will provide military assistance for the texas citizens, the united states would provide military assistance to the texas citizens

zyle1992:

Assuming they do survive long enough independently, they would need to build diplomatic relations.

it wouldn’t be a problem, after all, if texas did succeed and the (republican) texan government did get to do what they want to do in the first place then the new texan nation would be just about as far right as countries like iran, but with a different religion

Read full topic

You already have the state government, you can keep that or reshape it with a new constitution. If you need allies you can try to join NATO. Texas already have a border against Mexico, so that isn’t any problem.

European countries did fine with independence. It sounds like you have gotten your arguments from early 19th century.

item.source: State of Louisiana to withdraw from the United States of America

item.title: State of Louisiana to withdraw from the United States of America
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Let’s say that Texas, or any other state successfully secedes. At that point, they may no longer have the backing of the United States, or its allies. They would now be their own nation. They would need to create their own infrastructure. Most companies would take advantage of this, by serving the new nation, with increased cost. Companies could monopolize. They would still need a form of government, which may or may not be easy. One person could take over, and turn it into a democratic nation, or communist, or anything else. After that, laws would need to be made, or remade, because the federal government no longer has any leeway. Borders would be put up to protect the United States, so now there’s the whole international issue to deal with. Assuming the drug cartels don’t decimate the ex-state Texas, and they are not allies with anyone (cut ALL ties to US and Mexico) anyone can come in, take down this new weakened government, and claim the territory for themselves.

Assuming they do survive long enough independently, they would need to build diplomatic relations. It might be easier/harder depending on the actions they took to last this long. And if, at some point in the future, the decide they want to join back up with the US, many conditions would need to be met. It wouldn’t be a “Hey, long time no see, welcome back!” type thing. They would need to prove that they are capable of having a peaceful relationship, and compromises would have to be made in terms of laws and regulations.

Over all, at this point in time, it would be an absolute horrible idea to secede from the US, and is not a decision that should be taken lightly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

I find it hilarious a vast majority of you think state governments would be less corrupt without the presence of the federal government.
That logic is the very same logic that would then say that city governments would be less corrupt without the presence of the state governments.
Eventually it just boils down until total anarchism.

Regardless, these petitions hold no value at all in reality.

& Then, let’s say they do secede. They would almost immediately be taken over by the surronding country’s like Mexico and Canada providing them with tons of new economic resources.

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:65, topic:466538”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=582411.msg4158637#msg4158637 date=1352857438]

Lol, wat. Anyone can create a petition on there.

Niall: If you making petition where you demand that US go back under British control, I would sign it.

I need a whitehouse.org account to register and presumably an american address

but otherwise I totally would

They don’t check if you’re an American. They just ask for first and last name, and an e-mail address.
I really want a news report on it. How Americans have regretted the revolution and want back under the British Monarchy. Sadly it won’t happen (The news report).
[/quote]
I’d be happy with the USA turning into Britain. We’d have a much more efficient government, a better grip on our economy and budget, and hopefully the UK officials would put some rules in to stop this ‘whore’ disease that’s going around in America (it’s awful, 4/5 of the girls I know now are whores in some way or another).[/quote]
Only part there I can agree with.
